content: this legal text is a summary of a court case in belgium identified as f200071n which has reached the court of cassation the parties involved are not mentioned the case involves the flemish region and the government the plaintiff is represented by a lawyer from the court of cassation assisted by another lawyer from the brussels bar the defendant is represented by a lawyer from the court of cassation while the plaintiff is represented by an attorney from the bar province antwerp the case was initially heard in the ghent court of appeal where a decision was made based on the flemish tax code the court determined that the surviving spouse should receive half of the community property unless there is a deviation from equal division and justified their decision with the antiabuse provision in the tax code the judgment was set aside and the case was referred back to the court of appeal in antwerp the text also mentions the involvement of the flanders government and the minister of finance the plaintiff filed a petition in cassation claiming that the legal provisions were violated the main argument revolves around the application of inheritance tax and the determination of the taxable event the court of appeal agrees with the defendants argument that the time of the execution of the marriage contract should be the determining factor taking into account the antiabuse provision in the law principles of protection of property rights and legal certainty the court concludes that the death clause in the marriage contract should be subject to inheritance tax based on the new version of the law that came into effect on july 1 2015 the court also addresses the issue of transitional law and the retroactive effect of tax laws the plaintiff argues against the retroactive application of the new provision citing violations of legal certainty and protection of property rights the plaintiff requests the judgment to be set aside and the case to be remitted to another court of appeal
